response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Integer>> it = map.entrySet().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  e = it.next();
  System.out.println("e.getvalue: "+ e.getValue());
  System.out.println("min: "+ min);
  if(e.getValue() < min)
  {
    System.out.println("lower than");
    min = e.getValue();
    nm = e.getKey();
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new entrySet().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a map: :I have a map with a key and a value. I want to get the value of the key.
public static void main(String[] args) {
    Map<String, String> map = new HashMap<>();
    map.put("key1", "value1");
    map.put("key2", "value2");
    map.put("key3", "value3");
    System.out.println(map.get("key1"));
}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Map.Entry<String, String>> it = map.entrySet().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  e = it.next();
  System.out.println(e.getValue());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new entrySet().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
